#summary Library Reference

=lcd_4bit()=

==Description==


==Syntax==
lcd_4bit(rs, enable, d4, d5, d6, d7)

==Parameters==
rs: the number of the CIKU pin that is connected to the RS pin on the LCD.
enable: the number of the CIKU pin that is connected to the enable pin on the LCD
d4, d5, d6, d7: the numbers of the Arduino pins that are connected to the corresponding data pins on the LCD.

==Returns==
None.

==Example==
{{{
#include "LiquidCrystal.h"

void setup()
{
  lcd_4bit(8, 9, 4, 5, 6, 7);
  lcd_printString("Hello World!");
}

void loop()
{

}
}}}
